mork
Class Row

java.lang.Object
  mork.Row

public class Row
extends Object

A Row can be located either in the root of Mork files or in tables. A Row contains multiple values and has a row identifier associated. A row can also be scoped.

Author:
mhaller

Constructor Summary
Row(String content)
          Parse a Row in the given content (must include the brackets).
Row(String content, List<Dict> dicts)
          Parse a Row in the given content (must include the brackets) and resolves references using the given dictionaries.
 
Method Summary
 String getRowId()
          Returns the identifier of the row, usually a numeric value
 String getScopeName()
          Returns an optional scope of the row, might be null.
 String getValue(String id)
          Returns the value of a cell with the given id.
 Map<String,String> getValues()
          Returns a Map of all values found in the Row
 
Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

Row

public Row(String content,
           List<Dict> dicts)
Parse a Row in the given content (must include the brackets) and resolves references using the given dictionaries. The Row can optionally have a scope.

Parameters:
content - the Mork content of a Row including opening and closing brackets.
dicts - a list of dictionaries

Row

public Row(String content)
Parse a Row in the given content (must include the brackets). Does not resolve references as no dictionaries are given. The Row can optionally have a scope.

Parameters:
content - the Mork content of a Row including opening and closing brackets.
Method Detail

getRowId

public String getRowId()
Returns the identifier of the row, usually a numeric value

Returns:
the identifier of the row

getScopeName

public String getScopeName()
Returns an optional scope of the row, might be null.

Returns:
the scope of the row if defined, or null

getValue

public String getValue(String id)
Returns the value of a cell with the given id. The id must already be dereferenced.

Parameters:
id - the id of the cell
Returns:
the dereferenced literal value of the Cell with the given id

getValues

public Map<String,String> getValues()
Returns a Map of all values found in the Row

Returns:
a Map of all values found in the Row. The column header names (ids) and the values are already dereferenced.
